stories.text:
Has anyone done the two part MOOC (now on edX) by Gregor Kiczales from the University of British Columbia that is based on the book How to Design Programs (https://htdp.org/)? The MOOCs are called: 1. How to Code: Simple Data 2. How to Code: Complex Data

Previously they were called Systematic Program Design 1, 2, ..

How are the courses in comparison to the actual book?
stories.title: Ask HN: MOOC Based on How to Design Programs by UBC

stories.text:
Hey HN,

I found it painful to maintain huge bash scripts, so I wrote a library that makes it more natural to run subprocesses from Python so I could replace all my bash.

It's heavily inspired by SQLAlchemy, sh (the Bourne Shell), and sh (the Python library).

Hope you guys like it!
stories.title: Show HN: Shalchemy – Conveniently execute binaries from Python
